revised_title: Elastic Hysteresis in Steel: High-Speed and Static Experiments
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the elastic hysteresis in steel at high speeds and static conditions. They found that the hysteresis loss is likely the same at high and low speeds, and the shape of the hysteresis loop has been determined. The hysteresis loss in a hardened steel tube is about one-eighth of that in the same tube after annealing. The loss per cubic centimeter per cycle varies approximately as the cube of the stress-range.
